headline: Strawberry Spinach Salad
description: This strawberry spinach salad is mixed with almonds and topped with a fabulous homemade poppy and sesame seed dressing for a healthy lunch or side.

video.description: This bright and tangy salad is sweet and savory, and just delicious.
video.name: Strawberry Spinach Salad I

name: Strawberry Spinach Salad
recipeIngredient: 1 quart strawberries - cleaned, hulled and sliced
10 ounces fresh spinach - rinsed, dried and torn into bite-size pieces

recipeInstructions.text: Make dressing: Whisk together sugar, oil, vinegar, sesame seeds, poppy seeds, onion, paprika, and Worcestershire in a medium bowl. Cover and chill for 1 hour.
Make salad: Combine strawberries, spinach, and almonds in a large bowl.
Pour dressing over salad; toss to coat. Refrigerate for 10 to 15 minutes before serving.

review.reviewBody: I really liked this one - I've previously tried the combination of strawberry and arugula, and I must say, this one is even better. Will definitely be making it again ðŸ˜‰
I have made this salad for many potlucks and everyone raves about it and some ask for the recipe.

Excellent and quick salad. We have started making it regularly. As others have noted, sugar should be cut down unless this is your substitute for a brownie. Same with olive oil. 1/3 cup is perhaps sufficient. Using this as a base recipe, we have tried different toppings (cucumbers peeled and diced, roasted pumpkin seeds and other nuts, red onions etc). They all come out good. You can mix the produce and nuts and add dressing when ready to eat and it can be reused over a couple of days. Packs well for lunch if made in the morning.
It was too sweet. I would cut back on the sugar next time, and the dressing went a LONG way! It was so delicious though. I could not stop eating it.

This salad is AWESOME! I've made it several times, and even once in a pinch made it with a strawberry balsamic dressing I found in the produce section of the grocery. It worked well since I was in a hurry. Toasting the almonds really brings out the flavor!

Made this tonight for a little get together and it was a great hit! The only change I made was using balsamic vinegar, as suggested in previous reviews. It was delicious! In the future, I would probably cut the sugar in half as others commented for my own taste preference. But it was soooo good! A keeper for sure!
I loved it and will definitely make it again!

I'm new to strawberry salads, and made this exactly as written, except I only used 1/4 c. sugar and 1/4 c. (avocado) oil in the dressing. It was delicious. I sprinkled a bit of hemp seeds on top, and we chowed in. Great recipe.
This is just perfect for lunch when 105F out.

We loved this salad, served with deep-fried halibut and French Fries. I pulsed all of the dressing ingredients in my blender, ahead of time, and the dressing didn't separate. It was an easy salad to make at the last minute.

Wonderful salad. I substituted fresh blueberries and canned mandarin orange for the fresh strawberries. Yummy.
Perfect dressing.
Excellent summer salad. Loved it made as is, but next time Iâ€™ll cut the sugar back a bit.

This recipe makes at least three times more dressing than you'll need. So either cut down that amount or triple the amount of spinach. I found the dressing unnecessarily sweet, even with only 6T sugar. Next time I'd do 3T of sugar max.

This is a great salad! But I found conflicting direct in the written recipe compared to the video. The video omits the sesame seeds in the dressing. The video simply used them for a garnish. I made this both ways. The sesame seed in the dressing was WAY too much. A sprinkle on the top is nice. I avoid sugar so I used a powdered Bocha Sweet or powdered Swerve sweetener. The powder mixes better for this than the granular . If you donâ€™t have strawberries raspberries or blueberries are good in this too.
I reduced the amount of sugar to 3 tablespoons. This is a really good salad. I will consider adding feta cheese the next time I make this.
Delicious, easy and light!
It was healthy and delicious! The dressing was so tasty!!
Excellent! Iâ€™m not going to put so much sugar in next time.

This was absolutely delicious! I made some changes based on the reviews and what I had on hand. Used balsamic vinegar, made candied walnuts following another reviewers suggestion (mixed together egg white, sugar, cinnamon, nutmeg, then added walnuts, baked until golden), added blueberries & blue cheese . . . awesome salad that even my kids loved.

This salad was delicious! This was the first time that Iâ€™ve made my own dressing. It was a little too sweet so Iâ€™ll put half the sugar next time. Like others I added feta cheese. Thank you for sharing the recipe. Itâ€™s great to have a place to start to create something just right for your own tastes.
I decreased the sugar to 1/4c as others advised. Very good recipe.

Fantastic, quick prep and easy
Can shorten wait times, but better when you don't
Called for too many sesame/poppy seeds. The dressing was too strong
This is a great recipe! My husband doesn't even like strawberries but loved this salad. The dressing is the key! Thank you for such a great recipe!
This is so delicious! One of our favorites!
I just used brown sugar instead of white one, 2 tbsp, also I added grilled chicken and blueberries, was delicious! Next time I will use less oil, 1/2 cup was too much
Delicious! I have made it 3 times in the last 2 weeks! My family loved it. I used only 1/4C of sugar. It has few ingredients and is super simple to make.

I added toasted pecans, sliced red onion (soaked in water for 10 min), and goat cheese. Everyone loved it! Could add chicken and possibly some other berries or citrus fruit and would be a complete meal.
We really enjoy this salad. I add sliced red onions (instead of the minced onions) and crumbled feta. And because I'm Keto, I swap out the white sugar for monk sugar and I don't use as much.
Great salad. Exactly what I was looking for. I only added half of the sugar, just out of personal preference.
This was delicious! Will absolutely make this again.

This was delicious as described, especially with fresh farmerâ€™s market strawberries. As recommended by reviewers, I cut the sugar in half and used balsamic vs white vinegar. I also used Trader Joeâ€™s everything bagel seasoning as it had poppy seeds, sesame seeds garlic and onions. I addd additional freeze dried red onions. So simple and delicious and I had enough dressing to make 3 salads.
So delicious, the dressing was amazing.

Absolutely delicious.
I did change the amount of sugar to half and was sweet enough. 
will do it again, again, and again
Excellent recipe. Iâ€™ve used it with strawberries, with oranges, and with kiwis. Always delicious. My husband loves it. I did cut the amount of sugar.

Enjoyed this summer salad. Fresh ingredients was used from our garden. Did reduce the amount of sugar, oil and vinegar down when making the dressing. It was delicious! Added grilled chicken to my husbandâ€™s.
I made it just as listed and it was great. I used minced onions, the dehyrdrated kind. I threw it all in the ninja to mix it.
I think we'll try less sugar next time.
Amazing Salad! Loved everything about it :)
This was absolutely delicious! I didn't have any poppy seeds on hand so I just used sesame seeds. I will definitely make this awesome summery salad again!
I did like this salad and the strawberries I used were excellent but it just seemed like something was missing. I will make it again.
dressing was sweet but not too much, the nuts were a added crunch.
No changes. Must use fresh strawberries!!! We all love this salad. A must now for all family dinners.
Very little changes. I had sliced and frozen some strawberries before thawing and making this salad. Turned out perfect. Used balsamic vinegar. Worked great and will definitely make again.
This is a great meal in it self. Since I made this as part of dinner we had enough for 3 days. This salad is very flavorful and a great change from a regular salad.
It was easy, and refreshing. Sometimes you need a reminder to try these again. And the little extra tips really help
Best ever! Swapped out a few etc almonds to pepitas, added feta cheese. Dressing was superb

Way too much sugar!!!! 
I had to double oils and vinegar to cut the sugar.

Would make again, loved the dressing, very easy to make, used baby spinach as it was the only spinach available at the store, I made several slices through a handful of spinach to reduce the size of the leaves - because with the leaves and stems the size makes it difficult to get on a fork and in your mouth without getting the dressing on your lips, it also makes it easier to fold in the dressing. I made more dressing than needed (only needed salad for 2), the remainder went into disposable condiment containers for salads for lunches.
Have been asked to bring this to three get togethers after first bringing it to a pot luck. Like others, I just cut back on the sugar a bit and used balsamic vinegar. Just amazing flavour.
One of our favorite salads!
This went perfect with the Salmon I made for Christmas Dinner. So delicious.
It was very tasty but a too soggy for my liking.
This recipe is great. Love the dressing. I will definitely make it again!
I used white wine vinegar and a bit less on the olive oil. I also made the dressing one day ahead. Otherwise, easy and delicious.
I will definitely make again

I leave out the poppies and sesame seeds bc they get stuck in my teeth, less ingredients to buy and they donâ€™t change the overall taste of the dressing. A very small amount of sesame oil would work too IMHO. I also used about 1/3 c sugar to see if it would make a big difference and it was still great. We didnâ€™t have fresh strawberries so we used fresh tomatoes. My 10 yr old son gets sick of salads and he made 2 tonight! We added some chicken as well.

Pretty heavy on the sugar but delicious. I cut the recipe in half because it was just for my husband and I. I made the dressing in my Magic Bullet. I used 1 Tbsp of sugar and popped in a few strawberries and it was plenty sweet.
Took this to a potluck and everyone loved it! So easy to make.
I made this for the first time and everyone loved it. So easy and simple to make.

This was delicious made as the recipe called for, however there was too much of it for the amount of greens I had, which was a store bought bag. Next time I would halve this recipe or just add half and leave the rest on the side if people want to add more, they can. Lots of compliments!

Made it exactly as described except used a Strawberry Balsamic vinegar that I had on hand. Super salad - I added some diced chicken and it was great that way as well. The dressing on this is amazing - chilling it per the recipe is key to mixing the flavors. Husband loved it too and he's not a sweet salad guy. Thanks for submitting!

This was very good. I made it with baby spinach, and it got soggy quite quickly, even though I used a relatively scant amount of dressing. Added bacon and feta, which definitely gave it more complexity.
I only used 1/4 cup of sugar in the dressing, and it was still too sweet for my taste, but it was very well received at the potluck I took it to.

This recipe is quick and easy to make and a hit with everyone. I added chicken that I cooked in 2 T. Balsamic vinegar and 2T. Olive oil, grated fresh ginger and a slight sprinkle of garlic salt. Definitely a recipe Iâ€™ve used often for luncheons.
Its so easy and very delicious

This is my FAVORITE summertime recipe! To make it with a little more oompfh, I make homemade bacon bits, then I toast the almonds in a bit of the rendered bacon fat. Add a bit of feta and you have a nice filling meal....not necessarily super healthy anymore...but at least you are getting strawberries and spinach...
Everytime I make this salad its such a HIT!!! I used a little bit less sugar but it came out great
I made this for a BBQ and everyone loved it and several wanted the recipe. It's delicious!

Tasty salad. I used flaxseed instead of poppyseeds because this what I had in hand and it was great. Canâ€™t wait to make again with some other suggestions Iâ€™ve read. Oh and donâ€™t put dressing into salad it makes it too soft and witty.
easy, full of nutrition, and a BIG success!!
The only change I made was to puree some strawberries to add to the dressing.
Love it. Made it several time, just as written. We have our own strawberries so it's a great way to use them up. Had it with grilled salmon. The dressing was great on the salmon too.
Followed recipe, was great! Will add more almonds next time

My family loved this salad. The only change I made was to add blueberries to it. I usually make a poppyseed dressing for my salads but I thought this one looked interesting with the Worcestershire sauce addition. It was a hit! Everyone there asked for the recipe. Thank you for submitting it
Always a crowd pleaser......
I added blueberries and goat cheese. It was delish!
Dressing is to die for!
Make this for a family get together and it was a huge hit! So good and so easy!

Rave reviews! I had a bounty of both spinach and strawberries. I followed other reviewers suggestions to substitute balsamic vinegar, and halved the sugar. And toasted the sesame seeds. Doubled the dressing recipe and was happy to have extra. Do not dress the salad beforehand.
Iâ€™ll be making this one again. And again. And...
Everyone loves this salad and asks for the recipe. And, it's so easy to make!
I love this recipe! It is a favorite in our home. My husband has requested it several times. Itâ€™s so colorful and tastes delicious!

Great summer salad -- actually anytime if the strawberries are good and sweet. I make a large batch of the dressing and keep it in a labelled & dated jar in the fridge. This way it makes for an easy salad the 2nd, 3rd or 4th time you want more.

I have made this recipe many times. Have started adding feta cheese and diced chicken to make as a nice summer meal with deviled eggs on the side. 
My time saving way of making this is by warming vinegar in a jar to help dissolve the sugar. Grate the onion with a cheese grater for less cleanup, mix dressing by shaking in the jar, and then can easily store leftover w/o dirtying another dish.
Thank you for sharing this wonderful recipe!
Cut sugar to 1/4 cup and used cherries (dried) instead of strawberries hooray something different).
I made this per the recipe and it was devoured. The only change I'd make next time, similar to other reviewers, is to reduce the dressing a bit.
Just an awesome and simple salad.. We just Love It!
Wow!!! Big hit. You just canâ€™t go wrong with strawberries in a salad.
Super easy to make and tasted wonderful!

I used balsamic vinegar instead of white, and halved the sugar. I did not premix the dressing and spinach, but in the future I will to evenly coat. It was okay, but not amazing. Probably will not make again.
Delicious, even the kids loved it! So easy to make, will definitely be repeating this recipe!
Fantastic!
I reduced the sugar to 1/4 cup and it was still very sweet. It was also dripping with dressing, so I will likely stick to the 1/4 cup and use less of the dressing on the salad next time.
Easy, delicious and is even good the following day. I did cut back on the sugar by 1/4 cup, could have gone down to 1/2 cup.

I used balsamic vinegar and used red onions. I forgot about the poppy seeds as well. I don't usually care for these kind of salads, but this one was great! I made it for an early Easter dinner, and everyone raved about it! Will definitely make again.
Hubby liked it a lot also - hurray!!! This is a keeper!

This salad was a hit at the dinner party we went too. Me
Are the dressing as described, next time may cut the sesame seeds in half but otherwise was great. I also added blueberries and feta cheese. Will definitely make this again many more times.
very delicious

Took this to a family reunion. My vegetarian cousins loved it. I had to make it in a motel room, and it was easy to prepare. I love the zing the balsamic vinegar gives (I buy flavored balsamic for an extra layer of flavor.) The almonds add a nice crunch. The strawberries add a sweetness. And the spinach gives a healthy chew. Such a well-rounded salad.
